item.title: 0 ad
item.dc:creator: @Phillipe Phillipé
item.description:
@Phillipe wrote:

[quote=“Newty, post:11, topic:547244”][quote author=Phillipé link=topic=666149.msg4454401#msg4454401 date=1413775008]

http://play0ad.com/alpha-17-quercus/

Looks fun, I might download it… Does anyone wanna play?

I can tell you from quite a few hours played on the game that it’s definitely fun. The fact it doesn’t force you to crank out villagers to keep your productivity up is a really nice touch too.
[/quote]

I installed it a few days ago buy still haven’t played it. Would you say its better or worse then AoE2?[/quote]

That’s a hard one to decide due to the fact AOE2 is massive nostalgia, and I still play it now. I think AOE2 for its time was a lot more crisp that 0 A.D is at the minute, but do remember it’s still in Alpha.

As far as game design wise, I think 0 A.D offers more in terms of combat and gathering due to the fact you have a wider choice of options available. Formations are a lot better and provide bonuses against specific units, lower tier troops that aren’t built in the barracks (possibly conscripts? iunno what you’d class them as) can build and gather, territory expansion is expansion not free reign and build a tc on the opposite side of the map, etc. It’s good, I’d love for it to get more attention and more frequent updates

Read full topic

item.title: 0 ad
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

“0 A.D.” is a time period that never actually existed: In the usual calendar, one goes from 1 B.C. to 1 A.D. and skips zero. This reflects the historical fiction in the game: Who would have won if all the factions were pitted against each other when each of them was at its prime?

Also to you bickering about AD/BC:
Click

Read full topic

item.title: 0 ad
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Pure_, post:7, topic:547244”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=666149.msg4453443#msg4453443 date=1413149053]
ad doesnt stand for after death, it stands for anno domini
[/quote]did they teach you that at catholic school lil African
Because BC is the English abbreviation for Before Christ, it is sometimes incorrectly concluded that AD means After Death, i.e., after the death of Jesus.
lets mak ad latin
bc english
:-)S)SS[/quote]

what kind of a moron would conclude that??? we have 1 BC, and the year after that is 1 AD… Jesus lived for 33 years so you’re saying that the difference between the year -1 and the year 1 is 33 years ??? are you fudgeing retarded ???
